name: Snagit for Mac Capture
summary: Learn about .SNAGPROJ files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: TechSmith Snagit is a screen capture and annotation tool that technical writers and others use to create images for software documentation and tutorials. The Mac version of Snagit allows users to save annotated screenshots as SNAGPROJ files.

The SNAGPROJ format preserves annotations added to a screenshot as "unflattened" objects. This allows users to continue moving and editing those annotations in Snagit. Snagit also allows users to save annotated screenshots as .PNG, .JPG, .TIFF, .GIF, .BMP, or .PDF files, but those formats do not preserve annotations as editable objects.

NOTE: Prior to Snagit 2022, Snagit for Windows saved editable captures as .SNAG files. In Snagit 2022 and later versions, both platforms' versions of Snagit began saving editable captures as .SNAGX files.

instructions: You can open a SNAGPROJ file in TechSmith Snagit for Mac. To do so, select File â†’ Open... from the program's menu bar. Then, navigate to and open your SNAGPROJ file.
